title: Public Records Request Under Wis. Stat. §§ 19.31–19.39

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

To:
 Records Custodian
 Dane County Department of Human Services — Child Protective Services Division
 1202 Northport Dr., Suite 110
 Madison, WI 53704

From:
 Alexander Liam Lennon
 215 S Century Ave #227
 Waunakee, WI 53597
 (608) 214-6492 | alennon727@gmail.com

I. Statutory Authority
 Pursuant to Wisconsin’s Open Records Law (Wis. Stat. §§ 19.31–19.39), I respectfully request inspection or copies of the public records described below.

II. Records Requested
 A. Case-Specific Child-Welfare Materials
  1. Entire CPS investigative, assessment, and case-management files—including Initial Assessments, screening decision forms, Safety Plans, Protective Plans, case notes, dictation logs, Safe-Harbor referrals, Safe-Harbor interview videos/transcripts, and closing summaries—for all intakes or referrals naming:
   • Alexander Liam Lennon (DOB [REDACT]),
   • Liam Alexander Lennon (LAL) (DOB [REDACT]),
   • Lincoln Thomas Lennon (LTL) (f.k.a Lincoln Thomas Anderson-Acosta)(LTA) (DOB [REDACT]), 
   • Milania Ximena Lennon (MXL) (f.k.a. Milania Ximena Anderson)(MXA)(DOB [REDACT]), and
   • Tanya Marie Anderson or Tammy Pomplun or Patricia Butler or Jennilynn Gerhard or Hernando Acosta or Sonia Acosta or Caroline Fleming
   between 1 January 2019 and present—including, but not limited to, CPS ID numbers linked to WPD files 21-108846, 22-150587, 22-281057, 23-198723, 23-203060, 23-225308, and 24-117425.
  2. All audio or video recordings created or received by CPS (including Teams/Zoom recordings) relating to the above investigations.
  3. Copies of CHIPS petitions, court reports, permanency-plan reviews, and CASA/GAL reports filed with Dane County Circuit Court relating to the same minors or adults.

 B. Policy & Training Records (2018 – Present)
  1. Current and historical policy manuals, practice directives, and desk guides governing:
   • Parent/attorney access to child interviews;
   • Recording requirements for forensic or school-based interviews;
   • Credibility assessment of child statements and detection of coaching/undue influence;
   • Collaboration with law-enforcement agencies.
  2. Training curricula, agendas, sign-in sheets, slide decks, and post-training evaluations for social-workers or supervisors covering:
   • Safe-Harbor/NICHD forensic-interview standards;
   • Statutory “undue-influence” safeguards under Wis. Stat. § 48.981(3)(c)6;
   • Procedures for documenting and preserving exculpatory information.

 C. Internal-Affairs, Oversight & Complaint Data (2018 – Present)
  1. All citizen complaints, internal investigations, critical-incident reviews, or supervisory memoranda involving social-workers Heather Stertz, Angela Ivan, or Jessica Cooper, where allegations include:
   • Coercive interviewing or counsel exclusion;
   • Selective or biased enforcement;
   • Suppression or destruction of evidence.
  2. Annual Quality-Assurance or Program-Evaluation reports summarizing rule-compliance rates for interview recording and legal-representation accommodations.

 D. Communications & Correspondence (2021 – Present)
  1. All emails, texts, Teams/Zoom chats, and letters (plus attachments) exchanged between:
   • CPS staff (including Stertz, Ivan, Cooper, supervisors, and counsel) and any member of the Waunakee Police Department concerning Petitioner, LAL, or the referenced WPD case numbers;
   • CPS staff and Assistant District Attorneys Annie Jay or Timothy Verhoff;
   • CPS staff and Tanya Marie Anderson, Tammy Pomplun, Dr. Donna Rifkin, or Attorney Elisabeth Bach-Van Horn.
  2. All meeting agendas, minutes, calendars, or video recordings of multidisciplinary-team or case-staffing meetings at which the above investigations were discussed.

 E. Data-Retention & Destruction Logs
  • Any log, policy, or certificate of destruction indicating deletion, purge, or overwrite of recordings or notes relating to the requested investigations.

III. Time Frame
 Unless otherwise indicated, this request covers 1 January 2021 – present.

IV. Form of Production
 • Electronic copies in native format (.pdf, .msg, .xlsx, .mp4, etc.) are preferred.
 • Where native format is unavailable, provide high-resolution PDFs on a password-protected link, USB drive, or other agreed medium.

V. Fee Request
 • I seek a fee waiver or substantial reduction because release will advance public understanding of CPS operations and inform pending civil-rights litigation.
 • If estimated costs exceed $50, please supply an itemized estimate before proceeding.

VI. Expedited Processing
 • These records are material to imminent filings in a federal § 1983 lawsuit; timely disclosure is therefore requested.

VII. Record Preservation Notice
 • Please suspend routine destruction of any potentially responsive record until this request is fulfilled.

VIII. Redaction & Withholding
 • If portions are withheld, produce the segregable portions and cite each statutory exemption per Wis. Stat. § 19.36(6).

IX. Preferred Communication
 • Please acknowledge receipt by email and direct all follow-up to the contact information above.

X. Conclusion
 Thank you for your prompt attention. I look forward to an acknowledgment within ten business days, as contemplated by agency practice.

 /s/ Alexander Liam Lennon
 Alexander Liam Lennon

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alexander Lennon

title: Public Records Request Under Wis. Stat. §§ 19.31–19.39

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Wisconsin Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

To:
 Records Custodian
 Waunakee Police Department
 [CUSTODIAN ADDRESS]
 Waunakee, WI [ZIP]

From:
 Alexander Liam Lennon
 215 S Century Ave #227
 Waunakee, WI 53597
 (608) 214-6492 | alennon727@gmail.com

I. Statutory Authority
 Pursuant to Wisconsin’s Open Records Law (Wis. Stat. §§ 19.31 – 19.39) and all other applicable provisions, I hereby request prompt access to, or copies of, the public records described in Section II.

II. Records Requested
 A. Incident-Specific Materials
  1. Complete investigative files—including initial, supplemental, and closing reports; witness statements; photographs; audio; and video—relating to the following WPD case numbers: 21-108846, 22-150587, 22-165954, 22-281057, 23-099471, 23-198723, 23-203060, 23-225308, 24-117425, and any sub-incident or cross-referenced numbers.
  2. All body-worn-camera footage, cruiser-video, hallway-camera, interview-room video, and audio recordings captured by any WPD member in connection with the above-referenced case numbers.
  3. All CFS/dispatch logs, CAD printouts, radio traffic recordings, and MDT messages for the above incidents.
  4. Copies of search warrants, affidavits, criminal-complaint referrals, charging recommendations, and declination memoranda transmitted to the Dane County District Attorney’s Office for each incident.

 B. Policy & Training Records (2018 – Present)
  1. Current and historical Standard Operating Procedures, General Orders, directives, or memoranda governing:
   • Interview/Interrogation recording requirements (audio or video).
   • Child-abuse investigations, Safe-Harbor/forensic interviews, and predominant-aggressor determinations.
   • Evidence preservation, body-camera retention, and deletion protocols.
  2. Training curricula, lesson plans, attendance rosters, and post-training assessments provided to sworn personnel concerning:
   • Identification and mitigation of coached or recanted child statements.
   • Equal-protection or bias-based-policing prohibitions.

 C. Internal-Affairs & Complaint Data (2018 – Present)
  1. All citizen complaints, internal-affairs investigations, supervisory reviews, and disciplinary findings involving Officers Mitchell Flora, Jason Carbon, or any other member assigned to the referenced case numbers, where allegations include:
   • Fabrication or omission of evidence.
   • Failure to record interviews or activate body-camera equipment.
   • Selective or biased enforcement.
  2. Statistical summaries or annual reports that track use-of-force incidents, arrests, citations, and declinations disaggregated by gender of the alleged aggressor in domestic or child-abuse investigations.

 D. Communications & Correspondence (2021 – Present)
  1. All emails, text messages, Signal/WhatsApp/iMessage chats, body-cam uploads, and memorandum-style correspondence (including drafts and attachments) exchanged between:
   • Any WPD member (sworn or civilian) and members of Dane County CPS relating to Petitioner, his minor son, or the above case numbers;
   • Any WPD member and Assistant District Attorneys Annie Jay or Timothy Verhoff;
   • Any WPD member and Tanya Marie Anderson, Tammy Pomplun, Dr. Donna Rifkin, or Attorney Elisabeth Bach-Van Horn.
  2. All meeting agendas, minutes, or Teams/Zoom recordings where the referenced cases were discussed.

III. Time Frame
 Unless otherwise specified, the requested records span 1 January 2019 – Present.

IV. Form of Production
 • Provide electronic copies in native format when feasible (e.g., .mp4, .mov, .wav, .msg, .pdf).
 • If electronic delivery is impracticable, please advise of available alternatives (secure download, USB, or disc).

V. Fee Request
 • I request a waiver or reduction of fees under the public-interest provisions of Wis. Stat. § 19.35(3)(e) because disclosure will illuminate governmental performance, inform pending litigation, and promote public accountability.
 • If fees will exceed $50, please provide an itemized estimate before processing.

VI. Expedited Processing
 • Records are needed for imminent filings in federal civil-rights litigation (42 U.S.C. § 1983). Undue delay may prejudice my ability to comply with court deadlines; therefore, I respectfully request priority processing.

VII. Record Preservation Notice
 • I place WPD on notice to preserve all responsive records, including any scheduled for routine deletion or overwrite (e.g., body-camera auto-purge).

VIII. Redaction & Withholding
 • If any portion of a record is exempt, please produce the non-exempt portions and cite the specific statutory exemption for each withheld segment, as required by Wis. Stat. § 19.36(6).

IX. Preferred Communication
 • Direct all correspondence to the contact information above. Email communication is preferred for efficiency.

X. Conclusion
 Thank you for your prompt attention to this request. I anticipate your written acknowledgment within 10 business days, consistent with agency practice.

 Sincerely,

 /s/ Alexander Liam Lennon
 Alexander Liam Lennon

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Alexander Lennon

title: Plans to arrest Cambodian guerrilla leader Pol Pot of the Khmer Rouge (U.S. Department of State)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I hereby request any and all documents related plans put forward by the administration of President Bill Clinton to arrest Pol Pot, the leader of the Cambodia’s Khmer Rouge guerilla organization.

The date range would be between January 1, 1998 and December 31, 1998.

Independent sources corroborate the existence of this material:

https://www.nytimes.com/1998/04/11/world/us-seeks-china-s-help-in-arranging-pol-pot-trial.html

https://www.nytimes.com/1998/04/09/world/us-is-planning-a-move-to-seize-pol-pot-for-trial.html

https://www.thelocal.se/20090803/21064?gaa_at=eafs&gaa_n=ASWzDAhD433qJE7jn11-t-pDGtozLpexpu-EpCu_sTN0uuOTgxK60DUzVZjT9vXukYw%3D&gaa_ts=684c7ea7&gaa_sig=_2iAUGRRptAMw1CgRfsQ_GU-oDNTh6MLizvQP84mWR0Obov1I5EEL0S9mg-vaeNPlWj-qD-JcsxeQpNH1qROuA%3D%3D


I also hereby request any documents kept in “prohibited access”  filing systems, separated from conventional filing systems (such as Sentinel) in violation of FOIA laws.

Given that 27 years have passed since these files were generated, I expect them to be provided in full, without redactions.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Mary Patricia Nunan

communications.subject: Maine Freedom of Access Act Request: Information Involving Arrest of "Luke J. Fournier" (7/30/2022)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Maine Freedom of Access Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all police and arrest reports related to the traffic stop and subsequent arrest of "Luke J. Fournier" for OUI charges on or around July 30, 2022. The Charge Case Number is "22-38453".

Any mugshot photo related to the arrest of Luke J. Fournier in connection to this charge.

Audio of initial call made to police (if applicable).

All body-worn camera footage recorded by any Portland Police Department personnel during the initial stop, field sobriety testing, detention, arrest, and transport of Luke J. Fournier in connection to this charge.

All dash camera footage (including backseat view if applicable) from any patrol vehicles involved in the stop, detention, or transport of Luke J. Fournier in connection to this charge.

Please include footage captured shortly before, during, and immediately after the incident.

If portions of the requested footage are exempt or confidential, please produce the non-exempt portions and cite the specific legal exemptions justifying any withholding or redaction.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by 1 M.R.S.A. § 408(6). The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Scott Brass

title: Security Evaluation Criteria Used to Adopt SolarApp+

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Security Evaluation Criteria Used to Adopt SolarApp+
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act (Gov. Code § 6250 et seq.), I am requesting access to and copies of any and all records, communications, evaluations, or internal documents related to the City’s decision to implement or endorse the use of SolarApp+ for permitting solar projects.

In particular, I am seeking documents responsive to:
1. Any security assessments, audits, penetration tests, risk evaluations, or cybersecurity reviews conducted by or on behalf of the City prior to, during, or after adoption of SolarApp+.
2. All internal communications, staff emails, memos, or meeting notes discussing the security posture, data protection protocols, or vendor risk associated with SolarApp+.
3. Any contracts, MOUs, or agreements entered into between the City and SolarApp+ or its administering entities that reference system integrity, data handling, or compliance with information security standards.
4. Any communication with DOE, NREL, or associated contractors referencing security, risk, or due diligence in connection with SolarApp+ adoption.

For reference, the City's implementation of SolarApp+ is promoted on the following website: https://www.fairfield.ca.gov/government/city-departments/community-development/building-safety/solar-app. We are aware that similar platforms have undergone extensive technical and security evaluations by the City prior to approval. This request seeks to understand whether the same level of scrutiny was applied in this case.

Please include records regardless of format (emails, PDFs, memos, scanned documents, etc.) and from all relevant staff or departments involved in the decision-making process.

If any part of this request is unclear or overly broad, I am happy to discuss ways to narrow or clarify it. If any portion of the request is being withheld or redacted, please cite the specific exemption and legal justification.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ramon Vega

title: OpenAI Complaints About DeepSeek (Department of Homeland, Immigration and Customs Enforcement, National Intellectual Property Rights Coordination Center)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All communications sent to or received from OpenAI or its representatives about DeepSeek, including but not limited to OpenAI's allegations that DeepSeek  inappropriately accessed OpenAI's data. 

A representative of OpenAI includes but is not limited to lobbyists. Allegations of inappropriate access of data includes but is not limited to DeepSeek violating OpenAI's copyright. 

To assist with your search: OpenAI has made public allegations about DeepSeek inappropriately accessing its data. An example of an article detailing those allegations can be found here: https://www.nbcnews.com/tech/tech-news/openai-says-deepseek-may-inapproriately-used-data-rcna189872

Please exclude duplicates, news digests, press briefings, and other listserv emails that do not include substantive commentary.  Please let me know if I can be of assistance in clarifying my request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Merrick Wayne

title: BTD Streetscape Changes

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: BTD Streetscape Changes
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

pertaining to data gathering, analysis, and community engagement conducted for Roslindale Square by the Boston Transportation Department (BTD), Open Box, and any other consultants or partner organizations since January 1, 2024:

I -Reports and Deliverables
A. Any reports, including but not limited to:
    1. Survey instruments, responses, and tabulated data summaries
    2. Interim or final reports
    3. Memos
    4. Slide presentations
    5. Findings prepared by Open Box, BTD, or other consultants related to Roslindale Square

II - Public Participation Records
A. All materials and data associated with public engagement efforts, including but not limited to:
    1. Invitations, flyers, agendas, meeting minutes, slide decks, recordings, and handouts
    2. Screening criteria and methods
    3. Focus group interview guide
    4. Individual interview guide
    5. Number of individual participants and how identified
    6. Number of organizational participants and how identified
    7. Demographic breakdowns of participants (where collected), including but not limited to:
        a. Age
        b. Race/ethnicity
        c. Language
        d. Neighborhood
        e. Whether or not a business owner, and business information including but not limited to:
            i. Type of business
            ii. Business address
            iii. Duration of business presence in Roslindale Square
    8. Survey or feedback responses categorized by:
        a. Demographic information
        b. Geographic information
         c.  Roslindale Business Owner status (yes/no)

III - Methods used to ensure equitable outreach and engagement

IV - Organizational Participation
A. Records identifying organizations that participated in public engagement or stakeholder processes, including but not limited to:
    1. Organization names, number of representatives involved, and event dates
    2. Role or type of participation (focus group, listening session, steering committee, etc.)
    3. Contact person (name, title, email) for each participating organization (where available)
    4. Any formal or informal feedback or written submissions provided by these organizations

V - Correspondence
A. Email or written correspondence between BTD staff (including Directors), Chief of Streets, Open Box, Roslindale Village Main Streets, WalkUP Roslindale, Abundant Housing, Rozzidents for More Rozzidents, including but not limited to: Anna VanRemoortel, Laura Charles, Emma Blaxter, Alyssa MacNeill, Courtney Pong, Matthew Lawlor, Benjamin Bruno, Andrew Murray, Nate Stell, Elvira Moira or others regarding Roslindale Square, particularly where engagement methods, community data, or equity analysis were discuss
Consultant Engagement and Contracts
A. All contracts, scopes of work, MOUs, RFQs, and procurement documentation relating to the engagement of Open Box or other external consultants for work on the Roslindale Square assessment

VI -Data Collection and Analysis
A. All raw and processed data collected on transportation, traffic, pedestrian movement, parking, public space use, and effects on small businesses in Roslindale Square, including but not limited to:
    1. Camera footage, sensor logs, pedestrian/vehicle counts, and associated metadata
    2. GIS files, maps, and visualizations (e.g., heat maps, mobility models)

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rosaline Russ

title: GPS at Massachusetts Sheriffs Offices (Worcester County Sheriff's Office)

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: GPS at Massachusetts Sheriffs Offices (Worcester County Sheriff's Office)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Records that detail the extent of your office's usage of GPS technology to monitor people in the Sheriff office's custody. This includes individuals under pretrial, sentenced, on SORB, or any other custodial status. If such a program exists, I request records that show the number of individuals currently on GPS monitors, and their status (ie pretrial, sentenced, etc).

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joshua Dankoff

communications.subject: RE: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: GPS at Massachusetts Sheriffs Offices (Worcester County Sheriff's Office)
communications.communication:
Mr. Dankoff,

I am the Public Records Access Officer in receipt of your recent request.

The Worcester County Sheriff’s Office is responsible for the operation of the Worcester County Jail and House of Correction in West Boylston, Massachusetts. As such, we have no responsive records to your request as we do not use GPS monitors.

Thank you,

Anna Laukaitis
Public Records Access Officer
Worcester County Sheriff’s Office
5 Paul X. Tivnan Drive, West Boylston, MA 01583
Phone: 508-854-1983
[cid:image001.png@01DBDC3C.F31F12D0]
